p: The frequency of deaths adjusted for the population size in the mid-western states is shown in Figure 2. With the available data on race/ethnicity, Blacks/AA represent an estimated 34% of the total US COVID-19 deaths but make up 12.5â€“13% of the total US population, indicative of the excess burden of this pathogen on this community of color in IL, Chicago, MI, Milwaukee City and Milwaukee County in the state of Wisconsin.
